FuncDef:
The forward alarm cpu-usage multi-core disable command disables alarm or log reporting when the multi-core CPU average usage reaches the threshold regardless of service types.
The undo forward alarm cpu-usage multi-core disable command enables alarm or log reporting when the multi-core CPU average usage reaches the threshold regardless of service types.
By default, alarm or log reporting when the multi-core CPU average usage reaches the threshold is enabled.
CLIs: forward alarm cpu-usage multi-core { log | trap } disable
undo forward alarm cpu-usage multi-core { log | trap } disable

ParaDef.Info:
Disables log reporting when the multi-core CPU average usage reaches the threshold.
-

Disables alarm reporting when the multi-core CPU average usage reaches the threshold.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] forward alarm cpu-usage multi-core log disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To disable alarm or log reporting when the multi-core CPU average usage reaches the threshold regardless of service types, run the forward alarm cpu-usage multi-core disable command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
